author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: About 10,00 guns found in SC home of alleged drug dealer
text:
Chesterfield County Sheriff Police found up to 10,000 stolen guns packed in properties outside Pageland, S.C. He sure loved his guns.
A South Carolina man arrested for drug trafficking had packed a one-man arsenal of up to 10,000 stolen guns in a bunch of tractor trailers off a highway, police said.
“None of us have ever seen anything anywhere close to this,” Chesterfield County Sheriff Jay Brooks told WBTV.
More than 100 law enforcements officials Friday night raided the firearm-filled home of Brent Nicholson off Highway 9, outside the small town of Pageland. Authorities worked the scene for at least two days, and now have to go through the armory “piece to piece” to find the rightful owners of several thousand stolen weapons, Brooks said.
Nicholson even hoarded hundreds more guns at his parent's home and at a liquor store he runs with his dad, police said.
“There were so many guns we quit counting after a while,” Brooks told the Charlotte Observer.
Chesterfield County Sheriff Police estimate Brent Nicholson kept up to 10,000 guns. Enlarge Chesterfield County Sheriff Officers found many other odd items in Nicholson's home, including a massive number of hunting mounts. Enlarge Police estimate Brent Nicholson's homes had more than 10,000 and a variety of other odd items, including a massive number of hunting mounts.
It’s unclear why Nicholson needed so many guns.
“There’s no evidence that he even used them,” Brooks said.
“There’s no evidence that he was selling them – he just wanted them. His house looked like that hoarders program on TV.”
Officers also found more than 500 chainsaws, taxidermy supplies, hunting crossbows and 4-wheelers around Nicholson’s property -- much of which was also stolen.
Nicholson, 51, has been charged with trafficking opium and heroin. Deputies discovered his stash when they went to serve him with a subpoena Friday, and then busted him the next day.
Chesterfield County Sheriff Brent Nicholson, 51, was arrested a day after authorities tried to serve him a subpoena for drug charges. One of Nicholson’s neighbors was shocked to learn of the scary stockpiling next door.
“He’s always been a good cat, but you know, people do things,” Rusty Fender told WBTV.
He had quite a few questions for his former neighbor.
“What was you thinking?” he said.
“Why was you collecting that many firearms? What was you planning on doing with them? I mean was you planning on starting a riot?”
